summary: This is an email chain from November 12, 2019, discussing the handling of digital evidence (DVD files and a hard drive) in the case US v. Epstein. The correspondence involves arranging the return of DVDs containing processed data from a vendor and coordinating review of the vendor's work before upload to a document review platform (Relativity).

persons.name: Aime MalaWlam
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain regarding evidence handling in US v. Epstein.

persons.name: Andy
persons.context: Mentioned as the person to whom DVD evidence will be given for case file storage.

events.title: Evidence processing completion notification
events.description: A vendor completed document unitization and coding of data from 56 DVD files related to US v. Epstein, and emails coordinate the return of DVDs and review of the work.

keyFacts: A vendor processed data from 56 DVD files for the US v. Epstein case, involving document unitization and coding.
The processed data was to be uploaded to Relativity, a document review platform commonly used in legal cases.
The email chain indicates coordination among legal or investigative team members regarding evidence handling and review.
